00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup ADC_Private_Define ADC private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 #define ADC_ENABLE_BIT       (0x00000080)
00046 #define ADC_SOFTWARE_RESET   (0x00000040)
00047 #define LST_SEQ_SET          (0x0000001F)
00048 #define TCR_SC_SET           (0x00000001)
00049 
00050 #define HLST_SEQ_SET         (0x0000001F)
00051 #define HTCR_SC_SET          (0x00000001)
00052 
00053 #define ADC_VREF_MVDDAEN     (0x00000100)
00054 /**
00055   * @}
00056   */

00060   * @{
00061   */
00062 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00063  * @brief Deinitialize the HT_ADCn peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00064  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00065  * @retval None
00066  ************************************************************************************************************/
00067 void ADC_DeInit(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn)
00068 {
00069   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00070 
00071   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00072   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00073 
00074   if (HT_ADCn == NULL) // Remove the compiler warning
00075   {
00076   }
00077 
00078   RSTCUReset.Bit.ADC0 = 1;
00079   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00080 }
00081 
00082 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00083  * @brief Reset ADC.
00084  * @param HT_ADCn: is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00085  * @retval None
00086  ************************************************************************************************************/
00087 void ADC_Reset(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn)
00088 {
00089   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00090   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00091 
00092   HT_ADCn->CR |= ADC_SOFTWARE_RESET;
00093 }
00094 
00095 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00096  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified ADC.
00097  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00098  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00099  * @retval None
00100  ************************************************************************************************************/
00101 void ADC_Cmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, ControlStatus NewState)
00102 {
00103   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00104   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00105   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00106 
00107   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00108   {
00109     HT_ADCn->CR |= ADC_ENABLE_BIT;
00110   }
00111   else
00112   {
00113     HT_ADCn->CR &= ~(ADC_ENABLE_BIT);
00114   }
00115 }
00116 
00117 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00118  * @brief Configure conversion mode and length of list queue for regular group.
00119  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00120  * @param ADC_MODE: ADC Cyclic Conversion Mode.
00121  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00122  *     @arg ONE_SHOT_MODE      :
00123  *     @arg CONTINUOUS_MODE    :
00124  *     @arg DISCONTINUOUS_MODE :
00125  * @param Length: must between 1 ~ 8
00126  * @param SubLength: must between 1 ~ 8, only valid for DISCONTINUOUS_MODE.
00127  * @retval None
00128  ************************************************************************************************************/
00129 void ADC_RegularGroupConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_MODE, u8 Length, u8 SubLength)
00130 {
00131   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00132   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00133   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CONVERSION_MODE(ADC_MODE));
00134   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_LENGTH(Length));
00135   #if (LIBCFG_ADC_NO_DISCON_MODE == 0)
00136   if (ADC_MODE == DISCONTINUOUS_MODE)
00137   {
00138     Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_SUB_LENGTH(SubLength));
00139   }
00140   #endif
00141 
00142   #if (LIBCFG_ADC_NO_DISCON_MODE)
00143   /* Config cyclic conversion mode and length of list queue for regular group                               */
00144   HT_ADCn->CR = ((u32)(Length - 1) << 8) | ADC_MODE | (HT_ADCn->CR & ADC_ENABLE_BIT);
00145   #else
00146   /* Config cyclic conversion mode and length of list queue and sub length for regular group                */
00147   HT_ADCn->CR = ((u32)(SubLength - 1) << 16) | ((u32)(Length - 1) << 8) | ADC_MODE | (HT_ADCn->CR & ADC_ENABLE_BIT);
00148   #endif
00149 }
00150 
00151 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00152  * @brief Configure the corresponding rank in the sequencer for the regular channel
00153  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00154  * @param ADC_CH_n: the ADC channel to configure
00155  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00156  *     @arg ADC_CH_n        : ADC Channel n selected, n must between 0 ~ m (m represent the maximum external ADC input channel).
00157  *     @arg ADC_CH_DAC0_CH0 : ADC DAC0_CH0 selected
00158  *     @arg ADC_CH_DAC0_CH1 : ADC DAC0_CH1 selected
00159  *     @arg ADC_CH_DAC1_CH0 : ADC DAC1_CH0 selected
00160  *     @arg ADC_CH_DAC1_CH1 : ADC DAC1_CH1 selected
00161  *     @arg ADC_CH_IVREF    : ADC Internal VREF selected
00162  *     @arg ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
00163  *     @arg ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
00164  *     @arg ADC_CH_MVDDA    : ADC MVDDA selected
00165  * @param Rank: The rank in the regular group sequencer.
00166  *   This parameter must be between 0 to 7.
00167  * @param ...: Null parameter for API compatibility.
00168  * @retval None
00169  ************************************************************************************************************/
00170 void ADC_RegularChannelConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n, u8 Rank, ...)
00171 {
00172   u32 tmpreg1, tmpreg2;
00173 
00174   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00175   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00176   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00177   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_RANK(Rank));
00178 
00179   /* Get the old register value                                                                             */
00180   tmpreg1 = HT_ADCn->LST[Rank >> 2];
00181   /* Calculate the mask to clear                                                                            */
00182   tmpreg2 = LST_SEQ_SET << (8 * (Rank & 0x3));
00183   /* Clear the old SEQx bits for the selected rank                                                          */
00184   tmpreg1 &= ~tmpreg2;
00185   /* Calculate the mask to set                                                                              */
00186   tmpreg2 = (u32)ADC_CH_n << (8 * (Rank & 0x3));
00187   /* Set the SEQx bits for the selected rank                                                                */
00188   tmpreg1 |= tmpreg2;
00189   /* Store the new register value                                                                           */
00190   HT_ADCn->LST[Rank >> 2] = tmpreg1;
00191 }
00192 
00193 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00194  * @brief Configure the ADC trigger source for regular channels conversion.
00195  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00196  * @param ADC_TRIG_x:
00197  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00198  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_SOFTWARE   : S/W trigger
00199  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_EXTI_n     : where n can be 0 ~ 15
00200  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MTO  : where n can be 0
00201  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0
00202  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0
00203  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0
00204  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0
00205  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_MTO  : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00206  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00207  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00208  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00209  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00210  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_BFTMn      : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00211  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_PWMn_MTO   : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00212  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH0O  : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00213  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH1O  : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00214  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH2O  : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00215  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH3O  : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00216  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_CMPn       : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00217  * @retval None
00218  ************************************************************************************************************/
00219 void ADC_RegularTrigConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_TRIG_x)
00220 {
00221   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00222   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00223   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_TRIG(ADC_TRIG_x));
00224 
00225   /* Config external trigger conversion source of regular group                                             */
00226   #if (LIBCFG_ADC_SW_TRIGGER_ONLY == 0)
00227   HT_ADCn->TCR = ADC_TRIG_x & 0x0000001F;
00228   #endif
00229   HT_ADCn->TSR = ADC_TRIG_x & (~0x0000001F);
00230 }

00232 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00233  * @brief Configure the sampling time for the ADC input channel.
00234  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00235  * @param SampleClock: must between 0 ~ 255.
00236  * @retval None
00237  ************************************************************************************************************/
00238 void ADC_SamplingTimeConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 SampleClock)
00239 {
00240   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00241   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00242 
00243   /* config sampling clock of ADC input channel                                                             */
00244   HT_ADCn->STR = SampleClock;
00245 }

00247 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00248  * @brief Enable or Disable software start of the regular channel conversion of the selected ADC.
00249  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00250  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00251  * @retval None
00252  ************************************************************************************************************/
00253 void ADC_SoftwareStartConvCmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, ControlStatus NewState)
00254 {
00255   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00256   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00257   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00258 
00259   /* Start Conversion                                                                                       */
00260   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00261   {
00262     HT_ADCn->TSR |= TCR_SC_SET;
00263   }
00264   else
00265   {
00266     HT_ADCn->TSR &= ~TCR_SC_SET;
00267   }
00268 }
00269 
00270 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00271  * @brief Return the result of ADC regular channel conversion.
00272  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00273  * @param ADC_REGULAR_DATAn: where n can be 0 ~ 7
00274  * @retval The Value of data conversion.
00275  ************************************************************************************************************/
00276 u16 ADC_GetConversionData(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_REGULAR_DATAn)
00277 {
00278   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00279   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00280   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_DATA(ADC_REGULAR_DATAn));
00281 
00282   return ((u16)HT_ADCn->DR[ADC_REGULAR_DATAn]);
00283 }

00285 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00286  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified ADC interrupts.
00287  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00288  * @param ADC_INT_x: Specify the ADC interrupt sources that is to be enabled or disabled.
00289  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00290  *     @arg ADC_INT_SINGLE_EOC        :
00291  *     @arg ADC_INT_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00292  *     @arg ADC_INT_CYCLE_EOC         :
00293  *     @arg ADC_INT_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00294  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_LOWER         :
00295  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_UPPER         :
00296  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00297  * @retval None
00298  ************************************************************************************************************/
00299 void ADC_IntConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_INT_x, ControlStatus NewState)
00300 {
00301   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00302   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00303   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INT(ADC_INT_x));
00304   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00305 
00306   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00307   {
00308     HT_ADCn->IER |= ADC_INT_x;
00309   }
00310   else
00311   {
00312     HT_ADCn->IER &= ~ADC_INT_x;
00313   }
00314 }
00315 
00316 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00317  * @brief Check whether the specified ADC interrupt has occurred.
00318  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00319  * @param ADC_INT_x: Specify the interrupt status to check.
00320  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00321  *     @arg ADC_INT_SINGLE_EOC        :
00322  *     @arg ADC_INT_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00323  *     @arg ADC_INT_CYCLE_EOC         :
00324  *     @arg ADC_INT_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00325  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_LOWER         :
00326  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_UPPER         :
00327  * @retval SET or RESET
00328  ************************************************************************************************************/
00329 FlagStatus ADC_GetIntStatus(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_INT_x)
00330 {
00331   FlagStatus Status;
00332 
00333   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00334   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00335   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INT(ADC_INT_x));
00336 
00337   if ((HT_ADCn->ISR & ADC_INT_x) != RESET)
00338   {
00339     Status = SET;
00340   }
00341   else
00342   {
00343     Status = RESET;
00344   }
00345 
00346   return Status;
00347 }
00348 
00349 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00350  * @brief Clear the ADC interrupt pending bits.
00351  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00352  * @param ADC_INT_x: Specify the interrupt pending bits to be cleared.
00353  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00354  *     @arg ADC_INT_SINGLE_EOC        :
00355  *     @arg ADC_INT_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00356  *     @arg ADC_INT_CYCLE_EOC         :
00357  *     @arg ADC_INT_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00358  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_LOWER         :
00359  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_UPPER         :
00360  * @retval None
00361  ************************************************************************************************************/
00362 void ADC_ClearIntPendingBit(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_INT_x)
00363 {
00364   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00365   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00366   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INT(ADC_INT_x));
00367 
00368   HT_ADCn->ICLR = ADC_INT_x;
00369 }

00371 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00372  * @brief Check whether the specified ADC flag has been set.
00373  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00374  * @param ADC_FLAG_x: Specify the flag to check.
00375  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00376  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_SINGLE_EOC        :
00377  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00378  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_CYCLE_EOC         :
00379  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00380  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_AWD_LOWER         :
00381  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_AWD_UPPER         :
00382  * @retval SET or RESET
00383  ************************************************************************************************************/
00384 FlagStatus ADC_GetFlagStatus(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_FLAG_x)
00385 {
00386   FlagStatus Status;
00387 
00388   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00389   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00390   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_FLAG(ADC_FLAG_x));
00391 
00392   if ((HT_ADCn->IRAW & ADC_FLAG_x) != RESET)
00393   {
00394     Status = SET;
00395   }
00396   else
00397   {
00398     Status = RESET;
00399   }
00400 
00401   return Status;
00402 }

00404 #if (LIBCFG_ADC_NO_WDT == 0)
00405 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00406  * @brief Enable or Disable Lower/Upper threshold warning of the analog watchdog on single/all channels.
00407  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00408  * @param ADC_AWD_x:
00409  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00410  *     @arg ADC_AWD_DISABLE            :
00411  *     @arg ADC_AWD_ALL_LOWER          :
00412  *     @arg ADC_AWD_ALL_UPPER          :
00413  *     @arg ADC_AWD_ALL_LOWER_UPPER    :
00414  *     @arg ADC_AWD_SINGLE_LOWER       :
00415  *     @arg ADC_AWD_SINGLE_UPPER       :
00416  *     @arg ADC_AWD_SINGLE_LOWER_UPPER :
00417  * @retval None
00418  ************************************************************************************************************/
00419 void ADC_AWDConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_AWD_x)
00420 {
00421   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00422   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00423   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_AWD(ADC_AWD_x));
00424 
00425   HT_ADCn->WCR = (HT_ADCn->WCR & 0xFFFFFFF8) | ADC_AWD_x;
00426 }
00427 
00428 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00429  * @brief Configure the analog watchdog that guards single channel.
00430  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00431  * @param ADC_CH_n: where n must between 0 ~ m (m represent the maximum external ADC input channel).
00432  * @retval None
00433  ************************************************************************************************************/
00434 void ADC_AWDSingleChannelConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n)
00435 {
00436   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00437   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00438   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INPUT_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00439 
00440   HT_ADCn->WCR = (HT_ADCn->WCR & 0xFFFFF0FF) | ((u32)ADC_CH_n << 8);
00441 }
00442 
00443 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00444  * @brief Configure the high and low thresholds of the analog watchdog.
00445  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00446  * @param UPPER: must between 0x0000 ~ 0x0FFF
00447  * @param LOWER: must between 0x0000 ~ 0x0FFF
00448  * @retval None
00449  ************************************************************************************************************/
00450 void ADC_AWDThresholdsConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u16 UPPER, u16 LOWER)
00451 {
00452   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00453   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00454   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_THRESHOLD(UPPER));
00455   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_THRESHOLD(LOWER));
00456 
00457   HT_ADCn->WTR = (UPPER << 16) | LOWER;
00458 }
00459 #endif

00514 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00515  * @brief Configure the VREF output voltage.
00516  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00517  * @param ADC_VREF_x:
00518  *   This parameter can be one of the following value:
00519  *     @arg ADC_VREF_1V215 :
00520  *     @arg ADC_VREF_2V0   :
00521  *     @arg ADC_VREF_2V5   :
00522  *     @arg ADC_VREF_2V7   :
00523  *   For the 5 V version (LIBCFG_ADC_IVREF_LEVEL_TYPE2):
00524  *     @arg ADC_VREF_2V5   :
00525  *     @arg ADC_VREF_3V0   :
00526  *     @arg ADC_VREF_4V0   :
00527  *     @arg ADC_VREF_4V5   :
00528  * @retval None
00529  ************************************************************************************************************/
00530 void ADC_VREFConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_VREF_x)
00531 {
00532   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00533   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00534   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_VREF_SEL(ADC_VREF_x));
00535 
00536   HT_ADCn->VREFCR = (HT_ADCn->VREFCR & ~(3ul << 4)) | (ADC_VREF_x);
00537 }
00538 #endif
00539 
00540 #if (LIBCFG_ADC_VREFBUF)
00541 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00542  * @brief Enable or Disable the VREF output. When enable, the VREF provides a stable voltage output to the ADVREFP pin (ADC reference positive voltage).
00543  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00544  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00545  * @retval None
00546  ************************************************************************************************************/
00547 void ADC_VREFOutputCmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, ControlStatus NewState)
00548 {
00549   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00550      The ADCREFP pin should not be connected to an external voltage when the VREF output is enabled.
00551   */
00552 
00553   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00554   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00555   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00556 
00557   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00558   {
00559     HT_ADCn->VREFCR |= 0x00000002;
00560   }
00561   else
00562   {
00563     HT_ADCn->VREFCR &= ~(0x00000002);
00564   }
00565 }
00566 #endif
00567 
00568 #if (LIBCFG_ADC_MVDDA)
00569 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00570  * @brief Enable or Disable the power of MVDDA (VDDA/2)
00571  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00572  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00573  * @retval None
00574  ************************************************************************************************************/
00575 void ADC_MVDDACmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, ControlStatus NewState)
00576 {
00577   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00578   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00579   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00580 
00581   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00582   {
00583     HT_ADCn->VREFCR |= ADC_VREF_MVDDAEN;
00584   }
00585   else
00586   {
00587     HT_ADCn->VREFCR &= ~(ADC_VREF_MVDDAEN);
00588   }
00589 }
00590 
00591 #endif
00592 /**
00593   * @}
00594   */
00595 
00596 
00597 /**
00598   * @}
00599   */
00600 
00601 /**
00602   * @}
00603   */
